channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New Boeing CEO sets sights on 'leaner' future as quarterly loss tops $6 billion
item.description: Boeing had released preliminary results earlier this month showing a big loss and $5 billion in charges across its defense and commercial units.

item.title: Dollar on Path to Extend Winning Streak
item.description: The dollar keeps rising, as investors seem to embrace the idea that it won’t be easy for the Fed to cut interest rates so quickly.

item.title: Gold Snaps Winning Streak
item.description: Gold settled 1.1% lower, snapping a six-session winning streak. The decline came amid profit-taking by traders, but investors are seen as continuing t...

item.title: Deutsche Bank shares fell as lender's swing back to profit fails to impress
item.description: The partial release of 440 million euros of litigation provisions in the third quarter helped boost profit, Deutsche Bank said.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Rise Ahead of Storage Data
item.description: U.S. natural gas futures rose ahead of a weekly inventory report that’s expected to show a contraction in the inventory surplus.

item.title: Tesla set to report third-quarter earnings after the bell
item.description: In Tesla's third-quarter earnings report Wednesday, investors are going to be looking for specifics about the company's recently unveiled robotaxi con...

item.title: Coca-Cola tops earnings estimates, as higher prices offset sluggish demand
item.description: Shares of Coke have climbed 18% this year, raising the company's market value to nearly $300 billion.

item.title: S&P 500 Falls; McDonald's Shares Slide
item.description: Stocks opened in the red and never looked back during another busy day for earnings.

item.title: Oil Falls After U.S. Crude Stocks Build But Middle East Risks Cap Losses
item.description: Oil prices traded lower following a larger-than-expected build in U.S. crude stocks.

item.title: Coca-Cola CEO says McDonald's E. coli outbreak won't hurt beverage company's sales
item.description: Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey said an E. coli outbreak linked to McDonald's isn't likely to hurt the beverage company's sales at this stage.
